The Java program must be installed on your computer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9r2q1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"elrl2","text":"2. Calculations via chemical speciation software ORCHESTRA can be performed on Windows, Linux and Apple OSX, but the combination of PEST-ORCHESTRA can only be performed using Windows. We have only applied the software in Windows and the manual we have written is thus relevant to Windows and may not be applicable to use on Apple OSX or Linux.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5547a","text":"Calculations of iron (Fe) speciation using the NICA-Donnan model can be useful for development of an understanding of the physico-chemical parameters  (e.g. temperature, pH) that can influence Fe speciation in seawater (Hiemstra and van Riemsdjik. 2006; Gledhill et al. 2015; Avendano et al. 2016). Here we archive a protocol that can be used to calculate Fe speciation in seawater and derive new NICA constants for Fe binding to marine DOM, in combination with appropriately designed titration experiments. Importantly, for derivation of NICA constants, a pH dimension of sufficient resolution and breadth must be included in the experimental design. The protocol combines the chemical software ORCHESTRA with parameter estimation program PEST and was first described by  (Janot et al. 2017) to successfully derive NICA constants for Cd and Zn binding to standard Laurentian Fulvic acid. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rksn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Janot, N., Pinheiro, J.P., Botero, W.G., Meeussen, J.C.L., Groenenberg, J.E., 2017. PEST-ORCHESTRA, a tool for optimising advanced ion-binding model parameters: Derivation of NICA-Donnan model parameters for humic substances reactivity. Environ. Chem. 14, 31–38. https://doi.org/10.1071/EN16039","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"as8b9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4iha","text":"2. Meeussen, J.C.L., 2003. Orchestra: An object-oriented framework for implementing chemical equilibrium models. Environ. Sci. Technol. 37, 1175–1182. https://doi.org/10.1021/es025597s","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rhrt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8aa5t","text":"3. Doherty, J., 2019. PEST, Model-Independent Parameter Estimation, User Manual Part I.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mcfc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"e68ss","text":"Always check the constants in the Minteq4 data base for your chemical reactions of interest.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ea50","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eehhm","text":"An important caveat with respect to the calculations in ORCHESTRA is that the applied ion pairing model uses the extended Davies equation to correct for ionic strength. The Davies equation is only valid up to an ionic strength of ca. 0.5 and is therefore not really appropriate for seawater. Seawater ionic strength corrections are best performed using Pitzer equations but at the time of writing (Jan 2021) there is no user-friendly way to interface Pitzer models with binding by organic matter. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fqbf6","text":"The results are therefore biased in terms of absolute concentrations of metal species and results should be interpreted with this in mind.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d063p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
